title: 2faDestination
description: A two fractor authorization routing destination array object, used internally and semi-externally by the Kelpauth software family.

record.description: A schema-unique identifier for internal databases and body object referencing methods.

owner.description:
If your using `GET` this will contain a UUI schema, optionally when using `POST` you can reference the record number of the UUI to simply things.

*__Note__: Changing data inside the `POST`'s `UniversalUserIdentifier` other than the `id` will not having any affects on the record.*

allOf.description: You can either use the record id from a UniversalUserIdentifier query if using POST, or use the data inside this object with the UniversalUserIdentifier schema when using GET.

hasAccess.description: Tells you if the secured object will be present or not.

secured.description: This data can only be accessed if the target user has authorized your developer app and your using the generated token.

lastUsedCode.description: The generated data that the user needs to enter from their method's authorization app.

lastTimeGenerated.description: When the code was generated; mainly used for cooldowns on the front end.

codeHasBeenUsedYet.description: Has the user entered the code on their side? This lets other login instances know that the code is no longer fresh from the cyber-oven.

internal_metadata.description: You can ignore this, unless for some odd reason you'd like to use this data for your own personal caching purpouses. üòè

external_2fa_query_method.description: Tells the internal website system which API to query to generate or confirm the authentication code.

external_2fa_query_method - copy.description: Tells the internal website system which API to query to generate or confirm the authentication code.
